headline: Easy Quiche
description: Try this easy quiche recipe for breakfast, brunch, lunch, or dinner. Loaded with broccoli, ham, and Parmesan cheese, this quiche is totally crustless!

video.description: A delicious, quick-and-easy quiche with broccoli, ham, and cheese.
video.name: Easy Quiche

name: Easy Quiche
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 ounce) package chopped frozen broccoli, thawed and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 10-inch quiche dish.
Beat milk, Parmesan cheese, baking mix, butter, and eggs in a large bowl until well combined; batter will be lumpy. Stir in broccoli, Cheddar cheese, and ham. Pour into the prepared quiche dish.
Bake in the preheated oven for 50 minutes, until eggs are set and the top is golden brown.

review.reviewBody: Followed recipe. Used 2% milk. It was a success - will make again!

Super easy and quick to mix up. I skipped the veggies and added 1/4 cup of extra ham. I also mixed in some salt, pepper, and Spike seasoning. My only change for next time will be to either add one more egg or reduce the milk…the quiche was a little too moist. Maybe it will firm up once it cools. The flavor is fantastic though!
This was a good recipe for using left over Christmas ham. I cut it in half since it was for just my husband and me. Next time I’ll add a little more biscuit mix to firm it up more.

This is a great recipe but I don't use Bisquick because of aluminum, so I put into a mixing bowl 3/4 cup flour, 1 tsp baking powder, 1/4 tsp salt, 2 tsp softened butter, and combined with a pastry cutter. Then I added the 2 cups milk, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, 1 tsp garlic powder, 4 eggs, 2 tbsp melted butter, 1 cup ham, 1 cup baby portabella mushrooms, 1 cup chopped baby spinach, 1/4 cup diced onions, 1/4 cup diced green pepper, 1/4 cup diced roma tomato, about 5 oz grated cheddar, and about 1/4 cup parmesan cheese.
Easy recipe. Delicious and will definitely make it again. I added onion, asparagus, seasoned salt and pepper. The top came out a little brown after 50 minutes. I would check it around 45 minutes.
I've made this many times - never seams to fail to wow everyone!

This is delicious! You can skip the butter if you want to lighten the recipe. We've tried this with several different combinations: spinach and peppers; mushrooms and sausage; ground turkey, red and yellow peppers, green chiles, and spinach, and several other vegetarian options. I love this recipe! Super simple and is a great make-ahead meal prep option for the week!
Loved how easy it was to prepare. Great hit! Tastes great!
Very easy to make. Did not change a thing. Family loved it. Making it for Easter brunch. Joel
This recipe is so easy and so good! It is my go-to when I want to break the routine. I change up the meat when I want. I love it
Delicious - a little moist, so I will try cutting down the milk next time just to see. But was good as is.

Easy and great for a weeknight dinner. I went with the recommendation of the other commenter who halved the recipe. I did the same, and also made the biscuit mix using flour, baking soda, etc. I used a glass 8x8 pan and the quiche was about an inch thick when done. I went with frozen spinach. Everything tasted great! Halving the recipe and using an 8x8 pan meant it was done at about 45 minutes. Made four nice-sized servings. The crust was not thick, like a quiche or pie crust. It was just a bit of a thicker bit of the ingredients. If you're a quiche purist, which I am not, that may bother you.
Easy AND Delicious!
It is very good I made it before and my family love it
Easy, quick prep. Made two of them from left over Christmas ham. 4 stars, only because it could have used (additional) seasoning to earn 5 stars. Yes, real men eat Quiche!
I used 1 1/2 cups of milk. Tried spinach, but it's better with broccoli.
Easiest and Best Ever recipe for Quiche. Excellent!
Good and easy recipe. Subbed bacon bits from Costco for the ham and decreased milk as others suggested. Next time will try it with ham and with out the butter to make a leaner version.

I made this recipe several months ago for a family gathering and it was a hit. Today I got a craving and adjusted it for 2 servings (for myself). Did not have milk or broccoli, so substituted sweet peas and heavy cream with a dash of water. Added onions, garlic, salt, pepper and a few pieces of leftover bacon pieces from another meal. Mixed it up in a 2 cup measuring cup. It all fit into a small baking dish. It's a delicious Monday morning brunch.
Nice easy recipe, not the traditional quiche but very good
I swapped out the broccoli and ham for mushrooms and sausage. Super easy and tasted great.
!This was so good and so easy! I made it exactly as the recipe instructed with ham and broccoli. I think next time I will add mushrooms and some onion.

I thought it was easy to put together.
I would like to have had some onion maybe mushrooms in it. The parm gave it that salt bite. I love peppers so I will for sure use this recipe for a canvas of great flavors. Thanks again it's a keeper.

This is very good.
Use a little less shredded Cheddar.
Double for a large group and bake in a 15X10 dish.

I made this recipe exactly as written, except used spinach instead of broccoli. The quiche was absolutely delicious! No garlic or onions or anything else needs to be added to this recipe. Make it as is and be amazed!

This is so easy to make. It cooks up beautifully. I found it pretty bland. But it is a great platform for the favorite ingredients you/your family might have. Next time I will put in breakfast sausage and some salt/pepper, etc.
Easy. Loved by all!

This recipe worked out well for me. I skipped the ham and used extra broccoli and cauliflower. I also used only 1 cup of milk. Any more and it wouldn’t have fit into the pie shell. I thawed the frozen pie shell for just 10 mins before filling and it was cooked perfectly. I also sprinkled salt and a garlic seasoning mix on top before putting in the oven.
I followed K-S-M reviews alterations, and it was amazing!
iconic. super easy. no hassle, super customizable with ingredients.

Family favorite, very good and EASY.
I did use fresh very small florets.

Wonderful use for leftover ham. I made with spinach. Added a couple tablespoons of chopped onion and some homemade seasoning blend to ramp up the flavor just a bit. Easy to modify to your taste with different cheeses.

It is a great recipe but does need a little something extra.I have made this recipe a few times already and have made different substitutions according to my tastes.
 I like Parmesan cheese on things with tomato and I did not think that it fit with this dish. I have tried different cheeses with tasty results.
I forgot the butter tonight and think I will not put it in in the future as it really wasn't needed. The cheese has enough fat.
I added diced red pepper, onion, and garlic that I sauteed in bacon grease that was left from the home smoked bacon slab I cut some cubes from and fried. I also used leftover Christmas ham my other half smoked too. That made the dish the best tasting one yet. I often use green onion or scallions as some call them but I did not have any on hand. I missed that flavor addition tonight.
may put less grated parmigiana cheese next time. I added bell pepper and next time will add onion.

Very good! I followed some of the suggestions here: used 1.5 c of milk, bisquick for biscuit mix, added 1/4 of sautéed onion. I did not have broccoli or ham, so I used 1/2 c bacon bits! I also added about a tsp of Cajun seasoning and a tsp of salt. It fit in a 9.5 glass pie plate, baked for 45 minutes and turned golden brown. It’s a very basic recipe that can be easily modified to what you have on hand and very tasty!

Really the easiest, most reliable quiche recipe there is! I cut calories by skipping the butter all together and cut the dairy by using 1 1/2C unsweetened almond milk & add an extra egg. It sounds gross but it works. I agree w/others who add sautéed onions, garlic and spinach to add flavor.

Made this recipe as directed but I did take others advice and cut down on the milk. I let people salt and pepper their own and it was a big hit. I am getting ready to make again. I can see where you can add almost any veggies and cheeses you'd like. I might mix it up a little here and there. I think breakfast sausage would be delicious in it as well.

This seemed too easy to be this good - but it was GREAT! I don't love pie crust anyway, so this added just the right amount of heft without the crustiness. I made two and on one an actual soft crust did form at the base.
Made this today & looks beautiful! Tasted great!
made with different meats and veggies but worked out well
Added cooked mushrooms
This was absolutely delicious! I did add some onions and garlic and red bell pepper. I cook some bacon crumbled it up in there as well. It took 50 minutes in a 8x8 baking dish. ??

I think this recipe would be good as it is but I did things a bit different and it was wonderful. I added seasonings such as onion, shadon beni, black pepper and salt and just used self-rising flour instead of the biscuit baking mix. I also used bacon and a bit of salami instead of the ham. So I'd say you could easily make alterations to it.

Love the recipe. Made it at work for 60 residents and it was a huge hit. Definitely a keeper! I served the broccoli on the side and added onion powder, garlic powder and seasoning salt to the biscuit mix.
I’ve used this recipe for years. It’s super versatile and always turns out!
I made this with fresh broccoli and bacon. Very good!

This was excellent and so easy to make. Two small changes - added about 1/4 cup finely chopped sweet onions (Vidalia) and reduced the milk by 1/2 cup. Other than that, made it per instructions and it came out perfect.
This is a great recipe and easy to change up for how many servings you need. Changed it for two servings and they yurned out golden brown...very tasty too!! Enjoy!!
It is wonderful. I added 5 min to the baking time. So easy and quick to put together! Delicious!

delicious and simple! great way to use up whatever veggies and cheese I need to use up. I make these in muffin cups, bake for 25 minutes. it's the perfect size for quick grab and go weekday breakfast.

I love this recipe and I make it all the time. Every time I pour it into my dish to put it in the oven, I marvel at how pretty this dish is. They say we're supposed to "eat with our eyes too" by enjoying colorful dishes and this is that for sure! Thank you for this recipe! It's one of my staples!!
I love how versatile this recipe is for using up pretty much whatever I've got hanging around (cheeses, veggies). I make it in muffin pans for a quick grab and go protein breakfast.

I love this recipe, it is a staple of mine. I bring one of these to every potluck we have at work and it's always the first thing on the table to disappear. The first question I get asked anytime we're planning a potluck is 'are you going to bring one of your delicious quiches?' or 'Please bring a quiche!' I usually don't do ham/broccoli however as some of the people in my office hate ham in general (for whatever reason), so I do spinach and green onion, which everyone loves.
This was so delicious! Loved making a quiche without using a pie crust. Can't stop eating on it the next day.

I substituted shredded Italian blend cheeses for the grated Parmesan, and it was so good! I think next time I’ll try bacon instead of ham. I fully expected to want to top it with salsa to add some flavor, but I did not because it was so delicious. Highly recommend this recipe!

Super easy and convenient. I used a package of frozen spinach (thawed and water squeezed out with paper towels) in place of the broccoli because that’s what I had on hand, and it was really good. I’m sure the broccoli would have been good too. Glad I baked it for the full 50 minutes. It looked a little dark on top and it almost looked overdone, but it was actually perfect and the inside wouldn’t have been completely set up if I’d cooked it for a shorter amount of time. I’ll definitely put this in my Saturday morning breakfast rotation.
I love this recipe! So easy to make in one bowl! Came out great!
I used broccoli, tomatoes, and cut up slices of roast turkey. Turned out fluffy and delicious.
Turned out amazing! Made for Mother’s Day everyone loved it. Instead of ham I used bacon, also used a pie crust. Will make again.

I like this because no need for a pie crust! Mine came out a winner! Used large disposable pie tin and it fit perfect. I used all ingredients in recipe except broccoli. I used recipe prescribed amount of LandoLakes butter with Olive Oil & Sea Salt and it gave it the right amount of saltiness. I used 2% milk 1-3/4 cup. I sautéed fresh mushrooms onion garlic & spinach & added Buddig single package of ham diced up. I used fresh grated Parmesan-the whole cup of Parmesan really gave it flavor. I used cup of fresh grated cheddar. Added pepper. Only had to bake 44 mins and it was golden and fluffy.
I thought for at least an hour and the only word I came up with was YUMMY! The ONLY change i made was instead of biscuit flower i used regular flour.
my family LOVED this. so easy to make -- throw in what you like.
Turned out great! Easy to make as well.

My husband and I loved this quiche. So easy and full of yummy flavor. 
Terri
Pretty good! I substituted soy milk and lunch meat instead of ham. Tasted great!
Delicious! Came out perfect the first time and my family went back for seconds. I just added some additional seasonings(pepper, dry mustard, and onion powder).

This was amazing. I added 6 eggs and 1/4 cups milk because I like it more eggy. I used 1/2 the broccoli and added a small chopped onion. The store was out of bisquick so I used pancake mix instead and it worked great. The kids all loved it and no one would have wanted a crust. I cooked it in a large normal pan and it was done in about 43 minutes.

Delicious! I started with the recipe but used what we had in the fridge. Sautéed 8oz mushrooms and 1/2 diced onion, added an extra egg, skimped on the milk 1/4 cup. Middle was soft but was perfect upon serving. Ham cheesy goodness!

We loved this recipe. It's super light and fluffy. I think the best part about it is that you can change it up and add onion, mushrooms, peppers as you wish. I had my young adult son over and offered him some and he claimed that this quiche makes him want to move back home. Wait a minute...LOL!!
First quiche I’ve made and this was easy and delish! Love the fluffiness and lightness! We didn’t have a 10” pie pan so improvised ... it worked.
Everyone raves about this.
Followed K-S-M’s additions
Simple and turned out perfect with a few minor adjustments to make it our own. Definitely a family favourite that we will continue to make!

Good. Really need sauteed onion, garlic, red sweet pepper, garlic powder, pepper. I used less milk and also extra sharp cheddar. Taste very good, but I needed more kick. Some other spices I cannot figure out at this time
It was ok. I feel like it was missing flavor....just not sure what. It was enjoyed by my household overall. I made it as is and didn't add anything or change the recipe. Thanks for the recipe!
Delicious! I used Pamelas Baking Mix to make this gluten free. The only other change was pepper jack cheese instead of the cheddar.
Made it with the spinach substitution. It was excellent! We made no changes and will definitely make again.
Fantastic!!! Everyone Loved It!! I made with a crust but did not need it.

I’ve made this recipe many times over the years with ham and broccoli or sausage and spinach or bacon sometimes. The substitutions For meat and vegetables are endless, but the core recipe is the same. It has never failed.

This was very good. I only changed it slightly, as another reader suggested put on 1 1/2 cups of milk and forgot to add the butter and put in about 1.5 tablespoons of melted butter right before I threw it in the oven. It turned out great. Served it with a fruit salad.
I followed the recipe recipe just as it was my family went crazy about it this is definitely a keeper I'll be making it quite often. Thank you so much
Was SO GOOD!! I used frozen spinach and tiny bacon bits. I didn't have enough milk so I used a little half & half to make up the difference. I will definitely make this again!
SO GOOD! And very easy. I added some sautéed onion and I used the Red Lobster biscuit mix. I will most definitely be making this again!
wow!! is so good!! I would add a few red peppers next time and a little garlic and salt and pepper next time! but wow!! how delicious and easy!! definitely a keeper!!

This is a terrific recipe! You can make it exactly as written and it is an easy, quick & yummy weeknight meal. You can also adjust the cheese type, add-in meats and veggies to your taste (or as in our case, whatever is left in the fridge) and it still turns out great. Thank you for sharing!
Made it for my family. Everyone really liked it. Will make it again. Followed directions provided, but added green onions to it. Tasted delicious!

My husband loves this recipe! I'm a huge fan of how quick and easy it is. 
In terms of calories, if you use 1% milk, a full pie is 3193 calories and 1/8 (or one slice) is 399 calories.
If you're a pig like me and decide to also use a Pillsbury crust to line your pie pan (totally unnecessary), then it's 3993 calories for s full pie and 499 calories per slice.
Made into mini quiches by using muffin pan. Same temp only 20 mins to bake.
Super Easy recipe and my family loved it!
In my recipe, I added chorizo. I salute onions, with chorizo and added to the mix. I also made a second one with broccoli and mushrooms but the chorizo version was favorite..

I couldn't believe how wonderful this turned out. I didn't use ham because I wanted it to be vegetarian. I sauteed some green peppers and shallots and several cloves of garlic and used fresh broccoli in the mix. I also sprinkled the top with chipotle pepper to give it a little kick. The flour made a little crust on the bottom and the top browned nicely. It was delicious and I will make it again.
This was good but the cooking time and temperature listed is too long and too hot. I cooked mine at 350 for 45 min and it was definitely done! Next time I would use more Bisquick mix as well.

Like many others, I kept the basic recipe and made a few additions.
I added about 1 1/2 to 2 packages of spinach. I used 1 1/2 cup of milk.
Added both cheddar and parmesan cheeses, 1 onion, 3 cloves of garlic as well as a little green and red pepper for color. 
It is a 1 pot wonder. I will make this again and again. There were 3 women at my gathering and we almost finished it. They raved & asked for the recipe. My roommate will probably finish it off tonight. 
I used a large pie pan/ Quiche pan.
I can't express how great this recipe is. Thanks to the original cook.
This is so good! The only change I made was using fresh broccoli. I used ham that was already cubed so it didn't take long to put together.

This quiche truly is as easy as adding everything in one bowl and then transferring to the baking dish! I typically don't like to modify recipes until I've at least tried it once, however I was missing a few items and had to swap out some things. I don't use cow's milk so I used the unsweetened unflavored almond milk I had. You honestly would never know it because it has the cheeses to add richness. I also didn't have ham so I swapped that out for a package of pre-cooked bacon with no nitrites/ates. .

As I'm sure you've read in other reviews, this recipe yields much more than one pie. In fact it filled two pie dishes perfectly. I baked the filling in a pre-made Pillsbury crust from the frozen section. It was $1.99 for a pack of two. INCREDIBLY TASTEY! My partner is a veteran of restaurant management and LOVED this quiche. Looking forward to trying this next time with no crust and substituting other vegetables and cheese. That's really the beauty of dishes like this; once you know how to make it there are so many options!

This is one of the best recipes ever. It's also one that I usually have everything on hand for. It is delicious and I get compliments everywhere I take it. I have sent the recipe to so many people! I accidentally OMITTED THE BUTTER one time early on and my friends and I liked it better ! I NEVER put the butter in it and I think it's fluffier and firmer without it. The combinations I make are: spinach and mushroom and Spinach and bacon. Wilt the spinach and mushrooms in some water in a pan, drain and blot as much water as you can with a paper towel. Brown bacon and blot with paper towel.
Very easy to prepare. I would have liked a little spice. I might try adding some green chili’s next time.

Loved this recipe! I’ve never made quich and this was super quick and easy to throw together last minute with rave reviews. Only changes were that I used a bag of chopped cauliflower & broccoli mix and used my hand chopped to make bits a little smaller. I also used shredded Parmesan instead of grated because that’s what I had on hand.

Amazing! I will DEFINITELY be making this again. I used sausage instead of ham this first time and added way more herbs (shallot, green onions, cilantro, red bell pepper, garlic cloves) and I used spinach instead of broccoli. Still amazing!!!!
